numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Most respondents say that they send text messages to their parents at least once a day or a few times a week.
2. More young women than young men say that they send text messages to their parents at least once a day or a few times a week.
3. 75% of young women say that they send text messages to their parents at least once a day or a few times a week.
4. 50% of young men say that they send text messages to their parents at least once a day or a few times a week.
5. The graph has three categories.
6. Across all three categories, young women contact their parents more than young men contact their parents.
7. In-person visits are the least frequently used mode of communication in the graph.
8. The respondents are between 18 and 34 years old.
9. Most respondents probably do not live near their parents.
10. Some respondents may have demanding jobs.
11. Some respondents may be in rigorous higher-education programs.
12. Online communication has become more convenient in the 21st century.
13. Online communication has become more prominent in the 21st century.
14. I wonder why young women contact their parents more than young men contact their parents across all categories.
15. I wonder whether young women have closer relationships with their parents than young men have.
16. I wonder whether young women feel a stronger need for frequent communication than young men feel.
17. I will soon go to college.
18. I will soon turn 18 years old.
19. I wonder where I would fall on this graph.
20. I will maintain contact with my parents.
21. When I am away at college, my contact with my parents will probably be digital.
22. Parents want daughters because daughters keep in touch.
